alert.note: Alert for Mohave (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 18 at 6:14PM MST until August 18 at 9:15PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Mohave County in northwestern Arizona... * Until 915 PM MST. * At 614 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain east of Kingman, and more storms developing on the west side of Kingman. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kingman, Dw Ranch Road, Blake Ranch Road, Hualapai Mountain Park, Wild Cow Campground, New Kingman-Butler and Hualapai Peak. This includes the following roads... Hualapai Mountain Road between mile markers 1 and 12. Stockton Hill Road between mile markers 1 and 15. Interstate 40 in Arizona between mile markers 46 and 70. Route 66 between mile markers 57 and 81. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
